flawed_nl_solution:
If each bulb uses 60 watts each day, the 40 bulbs that Allyn has uses 60*40 = <<60*40=2400>>2400 watts of power each day.
In June, with 30 days, the bulbs will use 30*2400 = <<30*2400=27000>>27000 watts of power.
If Allyn is charged an electricity bill of twenty cents per power watt used, in June she will pay 27000*$0.2 = $<<27000*0.2=5400.0>>5400.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 72000, not 27000. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
